intro: Brossaea hispida, commonly known as the rough brossaea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique morphology and adaptation to arid environments make it an interesting subject for botanical study. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and resilience.
